body.instruction: Let's translate these sentences into English and identify the pronouns in each sentence! Then select each card to check your answer.
body.instruction_textversion: Let's translate these sentences into English and identify the pronouns in each sentence! Then check your answer.

back.content: Which goddess protects the homes of the Roman families? Nominative sg. f.
back.textversion:
Show Answer

Which goddess protects the homes of the Roman families? Nominative sg. f.

Whom did Romulus kill? Accusative sg. m.

back.content: I gulp down the food with my very hand. Ablative sg. f.
back.textversion:
Show Answer

I gulp down the food with my very hand. Ablative sg. f.

back.content: The doctor himself prepared the poison for his patient. Nominative sg. m.
back.textversion:
Show Answer

The doctor himself prepared the poison for his patient. Nominative sg. m.

front.content: Isti hostes arcem in oppido eorum aedificare coacti sunt.
front.textversion: Isti hostes arcem in oppido eorum aedificare coacti sunt.

back.content: Those nasty enemies have been compelled to build a citadel in their town. Nominative pl. m.
back.textversion:
Show Answer

Those nasty enemies have been compelled to build a citadel in their town. Nominative pl. m.
